SEARCH
Package util

Class CSVWriter

java.lang.Object
util.CSVWriter
public class CSVWriter extends Object
Specialized CSV writing utility using OpenCSV library. Provides robust CSV file writing with atomic operations and error handling.

This class wraps OpenCSV's CSVWriter to provide:

  • Atomic write operations (write to temp, then rename)
  • Automatic backup creation
  • Append and overwrite modes
  • Comprehensive error handling
  • Directory creation

Usage Example:


 String[] header = {"userId", "name", "email"};
 List<String[]> records = List.of(
     new String[]{"S001", "John Doe", "john@example.com"},
     new String[]{"S002", "Jane Smith", "jane@example.com"}
 );
 CSVWriter.writeAllRecords("data/students.csv", header, records, false);
Since:
2025-01-15
Version:
1.0
Author:
SC2002 Group 6 - Member 2

  • Method Details

    • writeAllRecords

      public static void writeAllRecords(String filePath, String[] header, List<String[]> records, boolean createBackup)
      Writes all records to a CSV file with header, replacing existing content. Uses atomic write operation (write to temp file, then rename).
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      header - the header row (column names)
      records - list of records to write
      createBackup - true to create a backup of existing file before overwriting
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if writing fails

    • appendRecord

      public static void appendRecord(String filePath, String[] header, String[] record)
      Appends a single record to an existing CSV file. Creates the file with header if it doesn't exist.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      header - the header row (used only if file doesn't exist)
      record - the record to append
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if appending fails

    • appendRecords

      public static void appendRecords(String filePath, String[] header, List<String[]> records)
      Appends multiple records to an existing CSV file. Creates the file with header if it doesn't exist.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      header - the header row (used only if file doesn't exist)
      records - list of records to append
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if appending fails

    • createWithHeader

      public static void createWithHeader(String filePath, String[] header)
      Creates a new CSV file with only the header row. Replaces any existing file.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      header - the header row (column names)
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if creation fails

    • ensureDirectoryExists

      private static void ensureDirectoryExists(Path directory)
      Ensures that the specified directory exists, creating it if necessary.
      Parameters:
      directory - the directory path to ensure exists
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if directory creation fails

    • createBackup

      private static void createBackup(Path filePath)
      Creates a backup of the specified file.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the file to backup
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if backup creation fails

    • deleteFile

      public static boolean deleteFile(String filePath)
      Deletes a CSV file if it exists.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file to delete
      Returns:
      true if file was deleted, false if it didn't exist
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if deletion fails

    • exists

      public static boolean exists(String filePath)
      Checks if a CSV file exists.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to check
      Returns:
      true if the file exists, false otherwise
